title: CLAUDE.md
text: file provides guidance Claude Code (claude.ai/code) working code repository.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: sdstudio R package providing Shiny GUI companion surveydown survey platform. transforms code-heavy survey creation visual drag--drop interface three main tabs: Build (visual survey creation), Preview (live testing), Responses (data analytics).

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Complete build workflow (recommended) source("build.R")  # Runs: load_all() ‚Üí document() ‚Üí install() ‚Üí build_site() ‚Üí check()

title: CLAUDE.md
code: devtools::load_all()      # Load package for development/testing devtools::document()      # Generate roxygen2 documentation devtools::install()       # Install package locally pkgdown::build_site()     # Build documentation website (deploys to sdstudio.surveydown.org) devtools::check()         # Check package compliance (R CMD check) devtools::test()          # Run test suite (minimal tests currently exist)

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # From GitHub (user installation) pak::pak("surveydown-dev/sdstudio", ask = FALSE)  # Local development install devtools::install(force = TRUE)

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Launch the studio application sdstudio::launch()  # With specific database encryption mode sdstudio::launch(gssencmode = "prefer")  # or "disable"

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Main Entry: R/studio.R - Contains launch() function (exported function) UI Definition: R/ui.R - Shiny UI floating button system three-tab layout Server Logic: R/server.R - Reactive programming real-time synchronization Utilities: R/util.R - Content processing helper functions

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Template System: 15 survey templates integrated Build tab Dual-Pane Editor: Visual builder + ACE code editor real-time sync Database Integration: PostgreSQL GSSAPI encryption connection pooling Responsive Design: Bootstrap 5 mobile preview modes

title: CLAUDE.md
text: CSS: inst/css/sdstudio.css - Custom styling drag--drop templates JavaScript: inst/js/sdstudio.js - Floating button interactions Citation: inst/CITATION - Package citation information

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Environment Variables: Uses .env files database credentials Database Modes: Auto/prefer/disable GSSAPI encryption modes Connection Pooling: Handles multiple database connections efficiently

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Single exported function: launch() (function NAMESPACE) Roxygen2 documentation: R files use roxygen2 documentation generation pkgdown deployment: Website publishes https://sdstudio.surveydown.org Testing: Minimal test structure exists tests/testthat/ - test coverage limited Licensing: MIT license standard R package conventions

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Real-time sync: Visual builder ‚ÜîÔ∏é ACE code editor bidirectional updates Mode switching: Local/DB mode affects preview response functionality Template injection: Survey templates populate visual code views simultaneously Undo/redo stack: Maintained server logic editing operations

title: CLAUDE.md
text: GSSAPI encryption: Three modes (auto/prefer/disable) PostgreSQL connections Connection pooling: Uses pool package efficient database connections Environment config: Reads .env files database credentials Fallback behavior: auto mode tries GSSAPI first, falls back plain connection Export functionality: CSV export Responses tab

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Three-tab system: Build (visual editor) / Preview (live app) / Responses (analytics) Floating buttons: Context-aware visibility based current tab mode Responsive preview: Desktop (widescreen) Mobile (375px) viewport modes Bootstrap 5: Custom CSS inst/css/sdstudio.css drag--drop styling JavaScript interactions: inst/js/sdstudio.js handles floating button behavior

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Core: shiny, bslib, htmltools, surveydown Database: DBI, RPostgres, pool Editor: shinyAce code editing integration Data: DT interactive data tables Environment: dotenv .env file configuration Utilities: later delayed execution

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting Providing bad information copying output AI assistants without verifying validity

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Contributing to Surveydown
text: welcome contributions Surveydown! can contribute many ways: opening issues provide feedback share ideas. fixing typos documentation submitting Pull Request (PR) fix opened issues submitting Pull Request (PR) suggest new features (considered good practice open issue discussion working pull request new feature).

what: To submit a contribution using a Pull Request
title: Contributing to Surveydown
text: Fork repository, clone locally, make changes new branch specific PR. example: Submit pull request. ok submit draft still working like feedback us. always good share open working . ‚Äôll try responsive possible reviewing accepting pull requests. much appreciate contributions!
code: # clone your fork $ git clone https://github.com/<username>/surveydown  # configure for your platform (./configure.sh for linux/mac  or ./configure.cmd for Windows) $ cd quarto-cli $ ./configure.sh  # checkout a new branch $ git checkout -b bugfix/myfix

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: sdstudio companion package building, previewing, managing surveys built using surveydown survey platform Graphical User Interface (GUI). studio runs local Shiny web app makes easier create, preview, manage surveys without extensive programming knowledge.

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Installing sdstudio: Make sure install surveydown well:
code: # Option 1: install from CRAN install.packages("sdstudio")  # Option 2: install from GitHub pak::pak("surveydown-dev/sdstudio", ask = FALSE) # Option 1: install from CRAN install.packages("surveydown")  # Option 2: install from GitHub pak::pak("surveydown-dev/surveydown", ask = FALSE)

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Simply call launch() function start studio:

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Drag--drop interface intuitive survey construction 16 survey templates covering basic advanced use cases Dual-pane editor visual builder code editor Real-time synchronization visual interface underlying code Undo/redo functionality editing operations Local/DB mode switching local testing database connection workflows

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Real-time preview survey build Responsive preview modes: Desktop (widescreen) Mobile (375px) views

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: Real-time analytics dashboard showing summaries responses local interactive data table PostgreSQL database integration connection pooling GSSAPI encryption support automatic fallback options CSV export functionality data analysis

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: sdstudio now supports online deployment using Supabase Storage! Deploy survey studio cloud work anywhere. Key Features: - ‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud storage - Store surveys Supabase Storage - üîÑ Auto-sync - Changes automatically saved every 10 seconds - ‚¨áÔ∏è Download - Export surveys ZIP files - ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Upload - Migrate local surveys cloud - üîí Secure - Private buckets optional user authentication Quick Start: 1. Create free Supabase account 2. Set storage bucket (see DEPLOYMENT.md) 3. Configure environment variables 4. Deploy shinyapps.io, Posit Connect, Shiny Server detailed instructions, see Online Deployment Guide.

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: currently 16 templates choose . default template contains minimum basic structure clean start. might also try question_type template showcase question types, try advanced features conditional_display, conditional_navigation, etc. full list templates, go surveydown-dev GitHub site search repo starting ‚Äútemplate_‚Äù.

title: Companion GUI for the surveydown survey platform
text: studio supports flexible database connection modes:
code: # Auto mode (recommended) - tries GSSAPI first, falls back if needed launch()  # Prefer mode - uses GSSAPI if available, plain connection if not   launch(gssencmode = "prefer")  # Disable mode - forces plain connection (useful for VPN environments) launch(gssencmode = "disable")

title: Launch surveydown Studio ‚Äî launch
text: function launches Shiny app 3 tabs: Build, Preview, Responses. Build tab includes template selection interface creating new surveys.

title: Launch surveydown Studio ‚Äî launch
Launch surveydown Studio ‚Äî launch
text: gssencmode Character string. GSS encryption mode database connection. Defaults "auto". Options include: "auto": Tries "prefer" first, falls back "disable" GSSAPI fails (recommended) "prefer": Uses GSSAPI encryption available, plain connection "disable": Forces plain connection without GSSAPI encryption

title: Launch surveydown Studio ‚Äî launch
text: return value, called side effects launching Shiny app.

title: Launch surveydown Studio ‚Äî launch
code: if (interactive()) {   # Launch studio (uses "auto" mode by default)   launch()    # Launch studio with disabled GSS encryption (for VPN connections)   launch(gssencmode = "disable")    # Launch studio with prefer mode (no fallback)   launch(gssencmode = "prefer") }

title: sdstudio 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2025-12-03 Updated compatibility surveydown >= 1.0.1 sd_next() deprecated navigation functions longer required intermediate pages. Auto-refresh now preserves 2 consecutive empty lines better formatting control.

title: sdstudio 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2025-11-11 Page break compatibility new surveydown package (>= 0.14.0).

title: sdstudio 0.1.2
text: Bug fix: database connection now fully compatible gssencmode = "auto" "disable" mode triggered.

title: sdstudio 0.1.1
text: Removed ‚ÄúQuestions (YAML)‚Äù template since .yml files yet compatible. Improved Modal UI slider_numeric question type.

title: sdstudio 0.1.0
text: Package renamed sdstudio (used sdApps). Launch studio sdstudio::launch(). 3 tabs: Build, Preview, Responses. Build tab: Survey creation 15 pre-defined templates, use . Preview tab: Live-preview survey. Responses tab: Survey responses management. tabs support local DB modes. set DB mode, input database credentials Responses tab.

title: sdstudio 0.0.3
text: launch() now compatible default fence format.

title: sdstudio 0.0.2
text: launch() now 2 sections Construction tab: Structure Code. Structure, pages contents drag-able editing deleting button. Code, survey.qmd app.R files live editable. Preview tab live preview survey Shiny app, ‚ÄúRefresh‚Äù button manually refresh preview.

title: sdstudio 0.0.1
text: Initial version.
